Software Maintenance Lead
description:
Description

Leidos is looking for a Software Maintenance Lead to join our team to provide software maintenance and engineering support to our customer. This position will manage four software maintenance teams made up of developers, systems administrators, and testers tasked to deliver the next generation of Geospatial Intelligence technologies to our customer. A successful candidate will have experience with Agile methodologies and the various tools necessary to run agile teams, as well as the ability to participate in release planning events, daily scrums, and other technical discussions as needed. The effort will harness GOTS, COTS and Custom technologies to deliver advanced production and dissemination capabilities using desktop, web and cloud technologies.

Position may be performed in the following locations below. Please note St. Louis, MO is the programâ€™s primary work location.
â€¢ St. Louis, MO
â€¢ Chantilly, VA
â€¢ Alexandria, VA

Primary Responsibilities
â€¢ Drive product delivery through keen understanding of the customer, mission, and product requirements
â€¢ Develop the team roadmap and support the team as needed to deliver on commitments
â€¢ Plan and prioritize epics, features, stories, and bugs
â€¢ Proven ability to write technical tasks with business value for the customer
â€¢ Help define, document, and track the completion of Epics, Stories, Tasks, and Bugs
â€¢ Communicate with other Product owners and scrum masters, program leadership, customers, and development teams
â€¢ Support agile meetings such as daily scrum, retrospectives, and program increment planning

Basic Qualifications
â€¢ Requires BS degree and 8+ years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 6+ years of prior relevant experience; OR 4 years of related experience in lieu of degree
â€¢ Must possess an active Top Secret Security Clearance with ability to obtain TS/SCI with Polygraph post hire.
â€¢ Must be a U.S. Citizen
â€¢ Thorough understanding of the following interfaces and formats: standard web services protocols (e.g., SOAP, REST, and OGC), NiFi, Tomcat, Python and ML. A minimum 3 years of experience with modern JavaScript development framework.
â€¢ Experience working with different ML models, such as Convolutional neural network, Natural language, Computer vision, object detection and classification, text parsing algorithms.
â€¢ Demonstrated understanding of Amazon Web Services (AWS), Ground Truth.
â€¢ Experience with delivery of a software maintenance solution using Agile software delivery techniques.
â€¢ Experience in integrating software, COTs, GOTS, FOSS, and capabilities into a baseline and making them an operational whole.
â€¢ Experience with proprietary and open source GIS applications and database services such as OpenGeo, ArcGIS Server, PostGIS and PostgreSQL, Oracle Spatial.
â€¢ Thorough understanding of the following program languages and systems (at a minimum): JAVA, PHP, JBOSS, Tomcat, Linux, Windows, Arcpy.
â€¢ Thorough understanding of integrating systems, databases of varying architecture.
â€¢ Experience with integrating security components with applications and databases.
â€¢ OpenLayers/Google Maps/ArcGIS APIs
â€¢ Familiarity with Configuration Management and Request for Change process for review and assessment.
â€¢ CompTIA Security+ Certification or equivalent

Preferred Qualifications
â€¢ Understanding of AWS/Cloud technologies
â€¢ Proven experience managing multiple baselines across multiple environments
â€¢ Experience with collaboration tools including Jira/Confluence and Rocketchat
â€¢ Experience with ArcGIS or geospatial technologies
â€¢ Experience with DevSecOps best practices and technology including Gitlab CI/CD
â€¢ Experience with infrastructure automation tools such as Cloud Formation, Chef, Ansible

Come break things (in a good way). Then build them smarter.

We're the tech company everyone calls when things get weird. We donâ€™t wear capes (theyâ€™re a safety hazard), but we do solve high-stakes problems with code, caffeine, and a healthy disregard for â€œhow itâ€™s always been done.â€

title: STE - Software Developer-Architect Jobs
description:
Description

BlueForce Inc. is seeking for a Software Developer-Architect in support of HQ USAF Sponsored and Supported Wargaming. Primary location is Joint Base Andrews, MD with occasional visits to The Pentagon.

Opportunity for remote work is mission oriented
â€¢ Subject to Contract Award"

The Contractor will conduct activities to plan, execute, manage, and analyze throughout all phases of HQ USAF wargames (concept development, objective and analysis/assessment planning, game design, event planning, management, and execution, and post-game analysis).

The Contractor will conduct development, maintenance, support, enhancement, and modernization of a Government-owned Wargame Information Environment (WIE) system and deploy it to/employ it at USAF-sponsored and supported wargame activities as required. This includes M&S tools and business applications that support the wargame planning, execution, and data collection processes.

Duties and Responsibilities:
â€¢ Designs, builds, tests, and deploys wargame specific software
â€¢ Systems engineering support in development, deployment, integration, verification, testing, maintenance, and demonstration
â€¢ Creates & helps integrate Wargame Information Environment tools, for example the wargame Multi-Agent Generative Engine (MAGE) software platform and artificial intelligence system designed to leverage multi-agent large language model frameworks (LLMs) and supported on an existing intranet
â€¢ Creates intuitive front-end user interface with multiple-user capabilities
â€¢ Develops and deploys/employs capabilities to integrate and dynamically update existing databases based upon user inputs

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
â€¢ Three (3) years of experience in software development.
â€¢ Demonstrated experience with User Interface/User Experience (UI/UX) design including map interfaces; expertise in fundamental program languages (C#, JavaScript, etc.) and web app design (HTML, CSS, etc.); and experience with ESRI and/or ArcGIS tools.
â€¢ Top-secret with SCI eligibility.
â€¢ Must have excellent oral and written communication skills.

title: Data Scientist at Tegna Tysons, VA
description:
Data Scientist job at Tegna. Tysons, VA.

About TEGNA

TEGNA Inc. (NYSE: TGNA) helps people thrive in their local communities by providing the trusted local news and services that matter most. With 64 television stations in 51 U.S. markets, TEGNA reaches more thanâ€¯100 million people monthly across the web, mobile apps, streaming, and linear television. Together, we are building a sustainable future for local news.

TEGNA Inc. (NYSE: TGNA) helps people thrive in their local communities by providing the trusted local news and services that matter most. With 64 television stations in 51 U.S. markets, TEGNA reaches more thanâ€¯100 million people monthly across the web, mobile apps, streaming, and linear television. Together, we are building a sustainable future for local news.

Role Overview
We are seeking a versatile Data Scientist to lead end-to-end modeling and insights for a multi-platform media ecosystem spanning linear TV, digital, web, social, streaming, and apps. You will transform rich viewership, content, and sales datasets into predictive models, optimization frameworks, and actionable insights that shape content strategy, audience growth, and advertising performance. Ideal candidates are adaptable thinkers who enjoy exploring ambiguous problems, can craft clear narratives from complex data, and bring fresh, creative approaches to a fast-evolving media landscape.

Responsibilities:
What Youâ€™ll Do
â€¢ Own the full data science lifecycle: problem framing, hypothesis design, feature strategy, model development, validation, deployment planning, and impact measurement.
â€¢ Build audience and engagement models using multi-source viewership and behavioral signals (e.g., forecasting, churn/retention, cross-platform attribution, time-series and panel-based analysis).
â€¢ Develop content intelligence with NLP: taxonomy/labeling, semantic similarity, topic and entity modeling, summarization, quality/relevance scoring, content-to-audience matching, and trend detection.
â€¢ Create sales and advertising analytics: demand forecasting, pricing/revenue optimization, propensity and uplift modeling, inventory allocation, and campaign effectiveness measurement.
â€¢ Design interpretable measurement frameworks: incrementality tests, controlled experiments, uplift/A/B testing, holdouts, and causal inference for content and ads.
â€¢ Unify cross-platform metrics to produce holistic funnels and KPIs; define leading indicators and build early-warning/nowcasting approaches for performance health.
â€¢ Engineer robust features from logs, sessions, sequences, and text; handle seasonality, cold start, sparsity, and platform-specific biases.
â€¢ Establish model governance: backtesting, stability monitoring, drift detection, fairness and bias assessment, and clear documentation of assumptions and limitations.
â€¢ Translate complex results into clear, executive-ready narratives; deliver recommendations that drive editorial, product, growth, and revenue decisions.
â€¢ Partner with editorial, product, sales, and audience teams to prioritize high-leverage opportunities and design data-informed roadmaps.
â€¢ Mentor teammates, elevate analytical rigor, and promote a culture of curiosity, experimentation, and measurable impact.

Core Skills and Methods:
â€¢ Statistical modeling and inference: generalized linear models, hierarchical/mixed effects, survival/retention analysis, causal inference (matching, diff-in-diff, instrumental variables where appropriate).
â€¢ Forecasting and demand modeling: univariate/multivariate time series, seasonality and event effects, hierarchical reconciliation, anomaly detection, and nowcasting.
â€¢ Machine learning for structured data: classification, regression, ranking, uplift modeling, and ensemble methods; strong emphasis on feature engineering and interpretability.
â€¢ Natural language processing for media: text normalization, embeddings, topic modeling, entity and key-phrase extraction, similarity search, content clustering, and evaluation of relevance/quality.
â€¢ Experimentation and measurement: A/B and multivariate testing, power analysis, sequential testing safeguards, uplift/causal experimentation, incrementally for ads and content.
â€¢ Optimization and decisioning: inventory and pricing optimization, budget allocation, scheduling/lineup optimization, and portfolio trade-off analysis.
â€¢ Data acumen: wrangling complex, high-volume, multi-platform datasets; designing reliable labels and ground truth; handling sparsity, delayed feedback, and feedback loops.
â€¢ Model evaluation and monitoring: rigorous offline/online validation, business-aligned metrics, calibration, stability, drift and leakage checks, and post-deployment learning.
â€¢ Communication and influence: concise storytelling with data, stakeholder alignment, and the ability to convert insights into concrete actions and tests.

Requirements:
â€¢ What Makes You a Great Fit:
â€¢ 5+ years of applied data science experience delivering measurable impact in consumer, media, advertising, or adjacent domains.
â€¢ Proven track record building models from viewership, content, and sales datasets, with shipped or adopted solutions that informed programming, growth, or revenue.
â€¢ Comfort navigating ambiguity, quickly forming hypotheses, and iterating toward practical, high-signal solutions.
â€¢ Balanced mindset across rigor and speed: you know when to prototype, when to harden, and how to quantify trade-offs.
â€¢ Strong collaboration skills and curiosity about how editorial, product, growth, and sales teams operate and make decisions.
â€¢ Commitment to responsible modeling: transparency, fairness, and clearly communicated limitations and risks.

Impact Youâ€™ll Drive:
â€¢ Clear, cross-platform understanding of audience behavior and content performance.
â€¢ Faster, smarter decisions on what to make, when to publish, where to distribute, and how to monetize.
â€¢ Better return on advertising through improved forecasting, allocation, and incrementality measurement.
â€¢ Scalable frameworks for experimentation, measurement, and continuous learning across the organization.

Preferred:
â€¢ Candidates with advanced degrees in the field of Data Science, NLP or similar.
â€¢ Candidates with prior experience working in Media or Content.

Benefits:

TEGNA offers comprehensive benefits designed to safeguard the physical, mental and financial health of our employees and their families. TEGNA offers two medical plan options for full and part-time employees through Blue Cross Blue Shield of Texas, as well as access to dental and eye care coverage; fertility, surrogacy and adoption assistance; disability and life insurance.

Our 401(k) program offers full, part-time and temporary employees the opportunity to contribute 1% - 80% of their pay on a pre-tax basis to TEGNAâ€™s 401(k). Contributions made up to the first 4% of pay are eligible for a 100% match from the company and are 100% vested from day one.

Regardless of participation in TEGNA medical plans, ALL employees and their eligible family members receive nine free virtual doctorâ€™s appointments with a physician through Teladoc, and 12 free annual therapy sessions with a licensed clinician through Spring Health.

TEGNA offers a generous Paid Time Off (PTO) benefit as well as nine paid holidays per year.
â€¢ Some jobs are covered by a collective bargaining agreement and thus some or all of the benefits described herein may not apply. For example, some newsroom bargaining unit employees receive health and retirement benefits under plans administered by the union.

EEO statement :

TEGNA Inc. is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, hiring and developing individuals from diverse backgrounds and experiences to add to our collaborative culture. We value and consider applications from all qualified candidates without regard to actual or perceived race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family responsibilities, disability, medical condition, enrollment in college or vocational school, political affiliation, military or veteran status, citizenship status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law. TEGNA will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with applicable law. If you are in need of an accommodation in order to submit your application, please email askhr@tegna.com

Recruiting Fraud Alert:

To all candidates: your personal information and online safety are important to us. Only TEGNA Recruiters or Hiring Managers will reach out to you regarding consideration of your application or background. Communications with TEGNA employees will either come from a TEGNA email address with a domain of tegna.com or one of our affiliate station domains.

Recruiters or Hiring Managers will never request payments, ask for financial account information or sensitive information such as social security numbers.

title: Senior Manager, Data Science | McLean, VA, USA
description:
Senior Manager, Data Science

Senior Manager, Data Science

Senior Manager, Data Science - Model Risk Office

At least 3 yearsâ€™ experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis

At least 3 yearsâ€™ experience with machine learning
â€¢

At least 3 yearsâ€™ experience with relational databases

Preferred Qualifications:
â€¢

PhD in â€œSTEMâ€ field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) plus 4 years of experience in data analytics
â€¢

At least 1 year of experience working with AWS
â€¢

At least 1 year of experience managing people
â€¢

At least 5 yearsâ€™ experience in Python, Scala, or R for large scale data analysis

At least 5 yearsâ€™ experience with machine learning
